title: Multipopulation Evolutionary Strategy HMS
text: HMS (Hierarchic Memetic Strategy) composite global optimization strategy consisting multi-population evolutionary strategy auxiliary methods. HMS makes use dynamically-evolving data structure provides organization among component populations. tree fixed maximal height variable internal node degree. component population governed particular evolutionary engine. package provides simple R implementation examples using different genetic algorithms population engines.

title: Multipopulation Evolutionary Strategy HMS
text: J. Sawicki, M. Łoś, M. Smołka, R. Schaefer. Understanding measure-driven algorithms solving irreversibly ill-conditioned problems. Natural Computing 21:289-315, 2022. doi: 10.1007/s11047-020-09836-w package provide implementation Simple Genetic Algorithm used demes. However default configuration uses SGA implementation GA package available CRAN.

title: Multipopulation Evolutionary Strategy HMS
text: run HMS default configuration arguments provided bounds domain: lower upper
code: library(hmsr) f <- function(x)  (x^2+x)*cos(x) HMS <- hms(fitness = f, lower = -10, upper = 10) HMS@best_solution #> [1] 6.560544

title: Multipopulation Evolutionary Strategy HMS
text: number parameters used strategy configuration. sample runs HMS Eggholder function - benchmark optimization problems.  see structure demes tree end evaluation, use printTree function display plot showing best solution changed evaluation use plot(HMS).
code: library(smoof) Eggholder <- smoof::makeEggholderFunction() lower <- rep(-512, 2) upper <- rep(512, 2) sigma <- list(rep(200, 2), rep(100, 2), rep(50, 2)) ga_config <- list(     list(         pmutation = 0.4,         mutation = rtnorm_mutation(lower, upper, sigma[[1]])     ),     list(         pmutation = 0.2,         mutation = rtnorm_mutation(lower, upper, sigma[[2]])     ),     list(         pmutation = 0.2,         mutation = rtnorm_mutation(lower, upper, sigma[[3]])     ) ) HMS <- hms(     fitness = Eggholder,     minimize = TRUE,     tree_height = 3,     lower = lower,     upper = upper,     run_metaepoch = ga_metaepoch(ga_config),     population_sizes = c(50, 30, 15),     sigma = sigma,     gsc = gsc_max_fitness_evaluations(20000),     sc = sc_max_metric(euclidean_distance, c(40, 20, 10)),     lsc = lsc_metaepochs_without_improvement(15),     monitor_level = "none",     with_gradient_method = TRUE ) printTree(HMS) #> f(476.52, 431.37) = 943.07 evaluations: 7675 A #> ├-- spr: (507.90, 402.59); f(480.26, 430.74) = 956.02 evaluations: 1955 A #> |   └-- spr: (507.49, 400.58); f(482.35, 432.88) = 956.92 evaluations: 879 A #> ├-- spr: (479.43, 436.05); f(478.82, 429.39) = 954.55 evaluations: 2341 A #> |   └-- spr: (480.59, 430.58); f(482.35, 432.88) = 956.92 evaluations: 1075 A #> └-- spr: (365.96, 500.10); f(507.31, 401.35) = 938.19 evaluations: 4293 A #>     └-- spr: (441.83, 454.04); ***f(512.00, 404.23) = 959.64*** evaluations: 2000 A

title: Function that runs one cmaes metaepoch. Wrapper function for cmaes::cma_es. — cma_es_metaepoch
code: tree_height <- 3 empty_config_cma_es <- lapply(1:tree_height, function(x) {   list() }) cma_es_metaepoch(empty_config_cma_es) #> function (fitness, deme, lower, upper, minimize)  #> { #>     cma_es_fitness <- ifelse(minimize, fitness, function(x) { #>         -1 * fitness(x) #>     }) #>     config <- config_cmaes[[deme@level]] #>     ignore_errors <- ifelse(is.null(config$ignore_errors), TRUE,  #>         config$ignore_errors) #>     population_size <- nrow(deme@population) #>     par <- if (deme@evaluations_count == 0) { #>         deme@sprout #>     } #>     else { #>         colMeans(deme@population) #>     } #>     iterations_count <- 5 #>     control <- list(maxit = iterations_count, keep.best = TRUE,  #>         mu = population_size%/%2, lambda = population_size, diag.sigma = TRUE) #>     if (!is.null(deme@context$sigma)) { #>         control$sigma <- deme@context$sigma #>     } #>     params <- list(par = par, fn = cma_es_fitness, lower = lower,  #>         upper = upper, control = control) #>     tryCatch({ #>         result <- do.call(cmaes::cma_es, params) #>     }, error = function(e) { #>         if (ignore_errors) { #>             warning("cmaes::cma_es failed with error: ", e) #>             return(NULL) #>         } #>         else { #>             stop("cmaes::cma_es failed with error: ", e) #>         } #>     }) #>     if (is.null(result$par)) { #>         warning("cmaes::cma_es returned NULL") #>         return(NULL) #>     } #>     population <- matrix(rep(result$par, population_size), ncol = length(result$par),  #>         byrow = TRUE) #>     value <- ifelse(minimize, result$value, result$value * -1) #>     fitness_values <- rep(value, population_size) #>     sigma <- utils::tail(result$diagnostic$sigma, n = 1) #>     list(solution = result$par, population = population, value = value,  #>         fitness_values = fitness_values, context = list(sigma = sigma)) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x55b81f752c30> #> <environment: 0x55b81f764718>

title: Function that runs one ecr metaepoch. Wrapper function for ecr::ecr. — ecr_metaepoch
code: tree_height <- 3 empty_config_ecr <- lapply(1:tree_height, function(x) {   list() }) ecr_metaepoch(empty_config_ecr) #> function (fitness, deme, lower, upper, minimize)  #> { #>     config <- config_ecr[[deme@level]] #>     legal_passed_param_names <- Filter(function(name) { #>         name %in% methods::formalArgs(ecr::ecr) #>     }, names(config)) #>     population_size <- nrow(deme@population) #>     iterations_count <- 5 #>     params <- list(mu = population_size, mutator = ecr::setup(ecr::mutGauss,  #>         lower = lower, upper = upper), lambda = 1L) #>     for (param_name in legal_passed_param_names) { #>         params[param_name] <- config[param_name] #>     } #>     params$fitness.fun <- fitness #>     params$n.objectives <- 1L #>     params$minimize <- minimize #>     params$lower <- lower #>     params$upper <- upper #>     params$n.dim <- length(lower) #>     params$initial.solutions <- matrix_to_list(deme@population) #>     params$representation <- "float" #>     params$monitor <- FALSE #>     params$terminators <- list(ecr::stopOnIters(max.iter = iterations_count *  #>         population_size)) #>     result <- do.call(ecr::ecr, params) #>     population <- list_to_matrix(result$last.population, length(lower)) #>     list(solution = result$best.x[[1]], population = population,  #>         value = result$best.y[[1]], fitness_values = result$last.fitness,  #>         context = NULL) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x55b81fd8caa0> #> <environment: 0x55b81fd8f958>

title: Function that runs one GA metaepoch. Wrapper function for GA::ga. — ga_metaepoch
code: tree_height <- 3 empty_config_ga <- lapply(1:tree_height, function(x) {   list("ignore_errors" = TRUE) }) ga_metaepoch(empty_config_ga) #> function (fitness, deme, lower, upper, minimize)  #> { #>     ga_fitness <- ifelse(minimize, function(x) { #>         -1 * fitness(x) #>     }, fitness) #>     config <- config_ga[[deme@level]] #>     ignore_errors <- ifelse(is.null(config$ignore_errors), TRUE,  #>         config$ignore_errors) #>     legal_passed_param_names <- Filter(function(name) { #>         name %in% methods::formalArgs(GA::ga) #>     }, names(config)) #>     params <- list(maxiter = 5, popSize = nrow(deme@population)) #>     for (param_name in legal_passed_param_names) { #>         params[param_name] <- config[param_name] #>     } #>     params$fitness <- ga_fitness #>     params$lower <- lower #>     params$upper <- upper #>     params$suggestions <- deme@population #>     params$type <- "real-valued" #>     params$monitor <- FALSE #>     tryCatch({ #>         GA <- do.call(GA::ga, params) #>     }, error = function(e) { #>         if (ignore_errors) { #>             warning("GA::ga failed with error: ", e) #>             return(NULL) #>         } #>         else { #>             stop("GA::ga failed with error: ", e) #>         } #>     }) #>     value <- ifelse(minimize, GA@fitnessValue * -1, GA@fitnessValue) #>     fitness_values <- ifelse(minimize, GA@fitness * -1, GA@fitness) #>     list(solution = c(GA@solution[1, ]), population = GA@population,  #>         value = value, fitness_values = fitness_values, context = NULL) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x55b82055aac0> #> <environment: 0x55b81aed0be8>

title: Maximization (or minimization) of a fitness function using Hierarchic Memetic Strategy. — hms
code: hms(   tree_height = 3,   minimize = FALSE,   fitness,   lower,   upper,   sigma = default_sigma(lower, upper, tree_height),   population_sizes = default_population_sizes(tree_height),   run_metaepoch = default_ga_metaepoch(tree_height),   gsc = gsc_default,   lsc = lsc_default,   sc = sc_max_metric(euclidean_distance, sprouting_default_euclidean_distances(sigma)),   create_population = default_create_population(sigma),   suggestions = NULL,   with_gradient_method = FALSE,   gradient_method_args = default_gradient_method_args,   run_gradient_method,   monitor_level = "basic",   parallel = FALSE,   use_memoise = FALSE )

title: Maximization (or minimization) of a fitness function using Hierarchic Memetic Strategy. — hms
text: tree_height numeric - default value: 5. determines maximum tree height usually reached unless strict local stopping condition, global stopping condition sprouting condition used. minimize logical - TRUE fitness shall minimized. fitness fitness function, returns numerical value, optimized strategy. lower numeric - lower bound domain, vector length equal decision variables. upper numeric - upper bound domain, vector length equal decision variables. sigma numeric - Vector standard deviations tree level used create population sprouted deme. population_sizes numeric - Sizes deme populations tree level. run_metaepoch function takes 5 parameters: fitness, suggestions, lower, upper, tree_level, runs metaepoch given deme population returns list 3 named fields: solution, population, value. gsc global stopping condition function taking list MetaepochSnapshot objects returning logical value; evaluated every metaepoch determines whether whole computation stopped. See gsc_metaepochs_count details. lsc local stopping condition - function taking deme list MetaepochSmapshot objects representing previous metaepochs; run every deme run metaepoch determines whether deme remain active. See lsc_max_fitness_evaluations details. sc sprouting condition - function taking 3 arguments: individual, tree level list Deme objects; determines whether given individual can sprout new deme given level. See sc_max_metric details. create_population function taking 6 parameters: mean, lower, upper, population_size, tree_level, sigma returns population Deme object created given tree level. suggestions matrix individuals initial population root with_gradient_method logical determining whether gradient method run leaves end computation refine best solutions. gradient_method_args list parameters passed gradient method run_gradient_method function - returns list named fields: solution, population, value monitor_level string - one : 'none', 'basic', 'basic_tree', 'verbose_tree'. parallel logical - TRUE run_metaepoch runs parallel. use_memoise logical - TRUE memoise package shall used cache fitness function values.

title:
Factory function for a trivial local stopping condition that
lets a deme be active forever. It is usually used in the root of
a hms tree. — lsc_trivial
text: Factory function trivial local stopping condition lets deme active forever. usually used root hms tree.
